metadata.dotPoint: Iodine number as a measure of degree of unsaturation in fats and oils

iodine_number_definition.name: Iodine Number Definition
iodine_number_definition.correct: The iodine number is the mass of iodine (in grams) that reacts with 100 grams of a fat or oil. It quantifies the degree of unsaturation.

volume of iodine.error: Iodine number is measured in grams, not volume.
volume of iodine.fix: It's mass of Iâ‚‚ (grams) per 100g of sample.

number of iodine atoms.error: It's mass of iodine, not number of atoms.
number of iodine atoms.fix: Iodine number = grams of Iâ‚‚ that react with 100g sample.
number of iodine atoms.action: It's a mass ratio, not a count of atoms.

percentage of iodine in the fat.error: Iodine isn't part of the original fat.
percentage of iodine in the fat.fix: It measures how much iodine REACTS with the fat, not what's in it.
percentage of iodine in the fat.action: Iodine adds to double bonds during the test.

persistent.gap: You don't understand what iodine number measures.
persistent.action: Definition: grams of Iâ‚‚ that add to C=C bonds in 100g of sample.

iodine_addition.name: Iodine Addition to Double Bonds
iodine_addition.formula: C=C + Iâ‚‚ â†’ C-C with 2 I atoms
iodine_addition.correct: Iodine adds across C=C double bonds in an addition reaction, similar to bromine. Each double bond reacts with one Iâ‚‚ molecule.

substitutes hydrogen atoms.fix: Iodine adds to the double bond; no atoms are removed.
substitutes hydrogen atoms.action: Addition increases the number of atoms; substitution replaces them.

reacts with single bonds.error: Only double bonds react with iodine this way.
reacts with single bonds.fix: Saturated (single bond only) fats don't react with Iâ‚‚.
reacts with single bonds.action: This is why iodine number measures UNSATURATION.

forms ionic bonds.fix: The iodine atoms become covalently bonded to carbon.
forms ionic bonds.action: This is similar to bromine addition to alkenes.

unsaturation_relationship.name: Iodine Number and Unsaturation
unsaturation_relationship.correct: Higher iodine number indicates more double bonds (greater unsaturation). Each C=C reacts with iodine, so more double bonds means more iodine reacts.

higher iodine number means fewer double.error: Opposite. More double bonds = higher iodine number.
higher iodine number means fewer double.fix: Each C=C consumes Iâ‚‚. More C=C = more Iâ‚‚ = higher number.
higher iodine number means fewer double.action: Direct relationship: unsaturation â†‘ = iodine number â†‘

iodine number doesn't relate to double b.error: Double bonds are exactly what iodine number measures.
iodine number doesn't relate to double b.fix: Iâ‚‚ only reacts with C=C bonds, so the number directly reflects unsaturation.
iodine number doesn't relate to double b.action: No double bonds = iodine number of zero.

all fats have the same iodine number.error: Different fats have different degrees of unsaturation.
all fats have the same iodine number.fix: Olive oil (unsaturated) has higher IN than butter (more saturated).
all fats have the same iodine number.action: Compare: coconut oil (~10) vs sunflower oil (~130).

persistent.gap: You don't connect iodine number to molecular structure.
persistent.action: Key: iodine number directly measures the number of C=C double bonds.

saturated_unsaturated.name: Saturated vs Unsaturated
saturated_unsaturated.formula: Saturated = no C=C; Unsaturated = has C=C
saturated_unsaturated.correct: Saturated fats have no C=C double bonds (low iodine number). Unsaturated fats have one or more C=C double bonds (higher iodine number).

saturated means full of water.fix: Saturated = all C-C single bonds, maximum hydrogen atoms.
saturated means full of water.action: No room for more hydrogen because no double bonds to hydrogenate.

unsaturated fats have no hydrogen.error: They have hydrogen, just not the maximum amount.
unsaturated fats have no hydrogen.fix: Double bonds mean fewer H atoms than if all bonds were single.
unsaturated fats have no hydrogen.action: Unsaturated can ADD hydrogen (hydrogenation) to become saturated.

both have the same iodine number.error: Saturated fats have near-zero iodine numbers.
both have the same iodine number.fix: No C=C = no reaction with Iâ‚‚ = iodine number â‰ˆ 0.
both have the same iodine number.action: Compare: saturated palm oil (~50) vs polyunsaturated oils (~130+).

persistent.gap: You're confusing saturated and unsaturated definitions.
persistent.action: Saturated = no C=C, maximum H. Unsaturated = has C=C, can add more H.

fats_vs_oils.name: Fats vs Oils
fats_vs_oils.formula: Fats = solid; Oils = liquid (at room temp)
fats_vs_oils.correct: Fats are solid at room temperature (more saturated, lower iodine number). Oils are liquid at room temperature (more unsaturated, higher iodine number).

fats and oils are chemically different.error: Both are triglycerides; the difference is saturation level.
fats and oils are chemically different.fix: Same class of compounds, different degrees of unsaturation.
fats and oils are chemically different.action: Both are esters of glycerol with fatty acids.

oils have lower iodine numbers.error: Oils are more unsaturated = higher iodine numbers.
oils have lower iodine numbers.fix: More double bonds = more liquid = higher iodine number.
oils have lower iodine numbers.action: Double bonds create 'kinks' that prevent tight packing = liquid.

temperature doesn't affect state.error: The definition depends on state at room temperature.
temperature doesn't affect state.fix: Same substance could be oil when warm, fat when cold.
temperature doesn't affect state.action: Room temperature (~25Â°C) is the reference point.

persistent.gap: You don't connect unsaturation to physical state.
persistent.action: More C=C â†’ more kinks â†’ less packing â†’ lower mp â†’ liquid (oil).

iodine_number_ranges.name: Typical Iodine Number Values
iodine_number_ranges.correct: Saturated fats have iodine numbers around 0-50. Monounsaturated oils are around 50-100. Polyunsaturated oils are 100-150 or higher.

all values are between 0 and 10.fix: Range is approximately 0 to 200 depending on unsaturation.
all values are between 0 and 10.action: Fish oils can have iodine numbers over 150.

higher is always better.fix: Different applications need different levels of unsaturation.
higher is always better.action: Food, cosmetics, industrial uses have different requirements.

iodine number can be negative.fix: You can't have negative mass of iodine reacting.

persistent.gap: You don't know typical iodine number ranges.
persistent.action: Memorise: coconut oil ~10, olive oil ~80, sunflower oil ~130.

health_implications.name: Health and Unsaturation
health_implications.correct: Unsaturated fats (higher iodine number) are generally considered healthier than saturated fats. Trans fats (from partial hydrogenation) are the least healthy.

saturated fats are healthier.error: Current guidelines recommend limiting saturated fat.
saturated fats are healthier.fix: Unsaturated fats are associated with better cardiovascular health.
saturated fats are healthier.action: Replace saturated with unsaturated where possible.

iodine number doesn't relate to health.error: Iodine number reflects saturation, which affects health.
iodine number doesn't relate to health.fix: Higher iodine number = more unsaturated = generally healthier.
iodine number doesn't relate to health.action: Not absolute, but a useful indicator of fat quality.

all fats are equally unhealthy.error: Different fats have different health effects.
all fats are equally unhealthy.fix: Omega-3 (highly unsaturated) is beneficial; trans fats are harmful.
all fats are equally unhealthy.action: The type of fat matters more than total fat intake.

persistent.gap: You don't connect chemistry to health implications.
persistent.action: General guide: unsaturated > saturated > trans for health.

practical_measurement.name: Measuring Iodine Number
practical_measurement.correct: Iodine number is measured by reacting a known mass of fat with excess iodine solution, then titrating the unreacted iodine. The difference gives the amount that reacted.

directly weigh the iodine added.error: The method uses titration of excess iodine.
directly weigh the iodine added.fix: Add excess Iâ‚‚, then measure what didn't react by titration.
directly weigh the iodine added.action: Amount reacted = amount added - amount left over.

colour indicates the exact number.error: Colour can indicate reaction, but titration gives the number.
colour indicates the exact number.fix: Quantitative analysis requires titration for accuracy.
colour indicates the exact number.action: Colour change shows endpoint; titration gives the value.

only works for pure compounds.error: Works for mixtures of fats and oils.
only works for pure compounds.fix: Gives average unsaturation for the sample.
only works for pure compounds.action: Useful for natural products which are mixtures.

persistent.action: Method: excess Iâ‚‚ + fat â†’ unreacted Iâ‚‚ titrated â†’ calculate reacted Iâ‚‚.

iodine_number_basics.instructions: Demonstrate complete understanding of iodine number concepts.

iodine_number_definition.title: Iodine Number Definition
iodine_number_definition.content: The iodine number is the mass of iodine (in grams) that reacts with 100 grams of a fat or oil. It quantifies the degree of unsaturation in the sample.

iodine_addition.title: Iodine Addition Reaction
iodine_addition.content: Iodine adds across C=C double bonds in an addition reaction. Each double bond reacts with one Iâ‚‚ molecule, forming two C-I bonds.
keyPoints: Each C=C reacts with one Iâ‚‚

unsaturation_relationship.title: Unsaturation and Iodine Number
unsaturation_relationship.content: There is a direct relationship: more C=C double bonds means more iodine reacts, giving a higher iodine number. Saturated fats have very low iodine numbers.

saturated_unsaturated.title: Saturated vs Unsaturated
saturated_unsaturated.content: Saturated fats have no C=C double bonds and maximum hydrogen. Unsaturated fats have one or more C=C bonds and can accept more hydrogen through hydrogenation.

fats_vs_oils.title: Fats vs Oils
fats_vs_oils.content: Fats are solid at room temperature (more saturated), while oils are liquid (more unsaturated). Double bonds create kinks that prevent tight molecular packing.

iodine_number_ranges.title: Typical Iodine Numbers
iodine_number_ranges.content: Saturated fats: 0-50. Monounsaturated: 50-100. Polyunsaturated: 100-150+. Examples: coconut oil ~10, olive oil ~80, sunflower oil ~130.

health_implications.title: Health Considerations
health_implications.content: Unsaturated fats (higher iodine number) are generally considered healthier than saturated fats. Trans fats from partial hydrogenation are the least healthy option.

practical_measurement.title: Measuring Iodine Number
practical_measurement.content: Add excess iodine to the fat, allow reaction to complete, then titrate the unreacted iodine. The difference gives the amount that reacted with C=C bonds.
